page.title: 07Main street Fulford
page.content: Main Street has seen better times. Though it has the few shops that are in the area its main function is that of a routeway between York and the A64, and most of the traffic is through traffic The shops themselves seem to be rather unusual perhaps trying to attract as many customers as they can, rather than simply catering for village trade. There is a{newsagency,}a{butcher's,}a} {chemist's,}a{bakery,}a{dairy}and a {fish and chip shop}but also a{frozen {food centre,}a{book shop,}a {bric-a-brac shop,}a{D.I.Y. shop,}a {florist's,}a{hairdresser's,}a {costumier's,}a{kitchen design centre, three{building societies,}three{pubs, a{garage}and of course a{post office. Finally there is one small, but attractive{guest house.}
